oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Capt. Walter Chandler's WWI journal
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: A clothbound WWI journal owned by Capt. Walter Chandler of the 114th FA. 30th Div., later a Shelby County congressman and mayor of Memphis. Several of the pages have entries. Entries include Col. Luke Lea placing him in command of the battery supply company (11/6/17); leaving for Camp Sevier (4/27/18); sailing for Liverpool in convoy on the British "S.S. Karoa;" after England arriving in Havre, France, visiting Rheims and hearing the "doleful sound" of big guns.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: World War, 1914-1918; World War, 1914-1918 - History
